name: Matthew Riley
biography:
Matthew Riley is a web and interactive designer currently lecturing in Animation and Interactive Media at RMIT. Matthew has worked ona range of interactive, on-line and print projects with Drome Pty Ltd, Arts Victoria, Chunky Move, the University of Melbourne, RMIT and the Australian Interactive Media Industry Association amoung others.
Matthew Riley is a Melbourne based new-media artist and designer who works with video, web and interactive media.
He was awarded a Bachelors degree in Education and Fine Art at The University of Melbourne in 1996 before completing three years of post-graduate study in multimedia and animation at RMIT, an Advanced Diploma in Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and a Graduate Diploma in Animation and Multimedia (AIM).
Primarily interested in language, image and sound relationships to examine contemporary and popular consumer culture his work has been exhibited at The Centre for Contemporary Photography, Arts Victoria, The Project Space and Monash University. In 2001 he was the only Australian selected for The New Talent Competition at Milia in Cannes, France, one of the worlds largest and prestigious multimedia showcases for his CD_ROM work 'Memo'.
He has often been invited to speak about new media art and design at conferences and institutions, including Fusion -the digital program at The St Kilda Film Festival, The London College of Printings Multimedia Department, the Japanese Broadcasting Corporation - NHK and the Net Zapping Festival in France.
He is currently working as a print, web and interactive designer at the multimedia studio Drome.
